data = {'name': 'Dora Factory (PAUSED)', 'url': 'wss://kusama.dorafactory.org'} @pytest.mark.parametrize("data", collect_nodes_for_chains(get_substrate_chains()), ids=task_ids) def test_can_create_connection(data): > connectin = create_connection_by_url(data["url"]) tests/test_nodes_availability.py:18: _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ scripts/utils/substrate_interface.py:30: in create_connection_by_url substrate = SubstrateInterface( .venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/substrateinterface/base.py:627: in __init__ self.connect_websocket() .venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/substrateinterface/base.py:665: in connect_websocket self.websocket = create_connection( .venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/websocket/_core.py:608: in create_connection websock.connect(url, **options) .venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/websocket/_core.py:253: in connect self.handshake_response = handshake(self.sock, url, *addrs, **options) .venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/websocket/_handshake.py:57: in handshake status, resp = _get_resp_headers(sock) _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ sock = success_statuses = (, , , ) def _get_resp_headers(sock, success_statuses: tuple = SUCCESS_STATUSES) -> tuple: status, resp_headers, status_message = read_headers(sock) if status not in success_statuses: content_len = resp_headers.get('content-length') if content_len: response_body = sock.recv(int(content_len)) #
